UI_visible_response: Yes, China's economy has been experiencing a slowdown recently. In 2024, the GDP growth rate declined to 4.8 percent year-on-year, and it is projected to continue facing challenges in the foreseeable future2. Additionally, in the third quarter of 2024, the economy expanded by only 4.6% year-over-year, marking the slowest annual growth rate, compared to a 4.7% rise in the second quarter4. Despite some recovery in previous years, such as an 8.1% growth rate in 2021 following a weak 2020, recent trends indicate ongoing economic deceleration amid various headwinds and uncertainties3.
traffic_visible_response: Yes, China's economy has been experiencing a slowdown recently. In 2024, the GDP growth rate declined to 4.8 percent year-on-year, and it is projected to continue facing challenges in the foreseeable future [[2]]. Additionally, in the third quarter of 2024, the economy expanded by only 4.6% year-over-year, marking the slowest annual growth rate, compared to a 4.7% rise in the second quarter [[4]]. Despite some recovery in previous years, such as an 8.1% growth rate in 2021 following a weak 2020, recent trends indicate ongoing economic deceleration amid various headwinds and uncertainties [[3]].
